en.title: Dresden
en.description:
Dresden is a city in eastern Germany located on the banks of the Elbe River. Typically known for its rich cultural heritage and stunning architecture, the capital of the state of Saxony is home to around 5 million people. Being one of the compact cities of the county with access to classic public transportation services, the Dresdeners need to travel less compared to the other cities considered in this set.

The vehicles kilometers traveled by Dresden dwellers in peak hour stand below 0.7 million kilometers, making it one of the lowest carbon-emitting cities. The congestion index of the city also stands below 1.1, one of the lowest among its competitors.
